alert.note: Alert for South Central Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 13 at 12:00PM PST until January 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...A wintry mix of rain, sleet, and heavy snow. Snow may affect all of the area, but the heaviest snow will be above 5000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph over exposed higher terrain and along Interstate 5 south of Weed. * WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County. This includes Snowmans Summit and Dead Horse Summit on Highway 89, I-5, and Mt Shasta Ski Park. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST this evening. The heaviest snow will occur through 5 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
